channel.title: If you have a yahoo account
channel.description:
I strongly suggest you switch to Gmail as soon as possible.
Reasons:
[ul][li]I changed my password and am not able to check my e-mails through Gmail[/li] [li]When connecting to Support about the above issue, I was asked to provide the answer to my [b]RECOVERY QUESTION[/b] for password resetting[/li] [li]Note that they're suing Facebook for ridiculous reasons, obviously showing signs of their failure to keep up with superior Google[/li] [li]... the list goes on...[/li][/ul]

item.title: If you have a yahoo account
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Because that message says invalid username or password, so they wanted to reset your password to rule that out?

Read full topic
item.source: If you have a yahoo account

item.title: If you have a yahoo account
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:14, topic:436863”]…[/quote]I was having problems connecting to the Yahoo! Mail Plus service through POP access, and they wanted to know the answer to my security questions. Their servers are total shit, see for yourself:

I had changed my password, then I started to get access denied problems. Why would I have to provide my security answers in order to resolve such an issue? I obviously changed my password in the POP access through Gmail.

Read full topic
item.source: If you have a yahoo account

item.title: If you have a yahoo account
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.source: If you have a yahoo account

item.title: If you have a yahoo account
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:9, topic:436863”]What the fuck do you think recovery questions are for? I want an answer.[/quote]Password recovery, not invalid access issues.

Read full topic
item.source: If you have a yahoo account

item.title: If you have a yahoo account
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

eczema3: I think it is easier to remember the password, and I just made the Yahoo account, but never used it.
Any site requiring me to write in a easily guessable answer in a normal text-field, is forcing people to have a low security on their account.

But only idiots forget their e-mail passwords, so why bother with recovery questions?

Read full topic
item.source: If you have a yahoo account

item.title: If you have a yahoo account
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:10, topic:436863”][quote author=tL link=topic=539578.msg3951882#msg3951882 date=1332361474]
What the fuck do you think recovery questions are for? I want an answer.
[/quote]
My answer on that question was: dsjfiojdspofjdspofjsdpo.

To avoid that anyone could guess it, or get access to my account.[/quote]

Well then that’s your fault, not yahoo’s.

Read full topic

item.title: If you have a yahoo account
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Doesn’t change the fact that this is standard practice, and not just for email but for lots of things including banks. Being asked for your recovery answer is not the same as being asked for your password.

Two-step verification is indeed useful, but god can it get on my nerves sometimes.

Read full topic
item.source: If you have a yahoo account

item.title: If you have a yahoo account
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

That’s what recovery questions are for?

Read full topic
item.source: If you have a yahoo account

item.title: If you have a yahoo account
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Greeny:

I agree yahoo is poop but being asked a recovery question is pretty much standard.

I’m pretty sure Google has moved past recovery questions completely? Iirc you need to answer a question as well as confirm a phone number or something, plus they have two-step verification which is probably the best thing to happen to logging in online since passwords

Read full topic
